items.name: <!DOCTYPE>
items.codeSnippet:
Hello, World!

This is a basic HTML document with a DOCTYPE declaration.
items.description: The <!DOCTYPE> declaration is used to specify the document type and version of HTML being used. In this snippet, <!DOCTYPE html> specifies HTML5, which is the latest version of HTML. This declaration should be the first thing in an HTML document, before the <html> tag. It ensures that the browser renders the document in standards mode, preventing compatibility issues.

items.name: <html>
items.codeSnippet:
Hello, World!

This is a basic HTML document.
items.description: The <html> element represents the root of an HTML document. It encloses all the content of the document, including the <head> and <body> sections. In this snippet, the <html> tag is part of the overall HTML document structure.

items.name: <head>
items.codeSnippet:
<head>
	<!-- Metadata and document settings -->
	<title>Your Title Here</title>
</head>
items.description: The <head> element is a container for metadata about the HTML document. It typically contains elements such as <title>, <meta>, <link>, <style>, and <script>. In this snippet, the <head> section includes a <title> element.

items.name: <body>
items.codeSnippet:
Hello, World!

This is a basic HTML document.
items.description: The <body> element contains the visible content of the HTML document, such as text, images, links, and other elements. It typically follows the <head> section and precedes the closing </html> tag. In this snippet, the <body> element encloses the main content of the HTML document.

items.name: <h1>-<h6>
items.description: The <h1>-<h6> elements represent six levels of section headings, where <h1> is the highest level and <h6> is the lowest.

The

element represents a paragraph of text.

The
element represents a line break within a paragraph.

items.name: <hr>
items.description: The <hr> element represents a thematic break or separation in content.

items.name: <button>
items.description: The <button> element represents a clickable button.

items.name: <input type=>
items.description: The <input> element is used to create interactive controls for web-based forms. The 'type' attribute specifies the type of input control.

items.name: <label>
items.description: The <label> element represents a label for an <input> element. The 'for' attribute specifies which form element the label is bound to.

items.name: <table>
items.description: The <table> element represents tabular data.

items.name: <tr>
items.description: The <tr> element represents a row in a table.

items.name: <td>
items.description: The <td> element represents a data cell in a table.

items.name: <th>
items.description: The <th> element represents a header cell in a table.

items.name: <form>
items.description: The <form> element represents a form for user input. The 'action' attribute specifies where to send the form data, and the 'method' attribute specifies the HTTP method to use for sending the form data.

items.name: <input>
items.description: The <input> element represents an input control. The 'type' attribute specifies the type of input control, and the 'name' attribute specifies the name of the input control.

items.name: <textarea>
items.description: The <textarea> element represents a multi-line text input control. The 'rows' and 'cols' attributes specify the visible height and width of the textarea.

items.name: <select>
items.description: The <select> element represents a control for selecting among a set of options. Each <option> element within the <select> represents an option in the dropdown list.

items.name: <button>
items.description: The <button> element represents a clickable button. The 'type' attribute specifies the type of button, such as 'submit', 'reset', or 'button'.

items.name: <audio>
items.description: The <audio> element embeds audio content in an HTML document. The 'controls' attribute adds audio controls, such as play, pause, and volume.

items.name: <video>
items.description: The <video> element embeds video content in an HTML document. The 'controls' attribute adds video controls, such as play, pause, and volume.

items.name: <source>
items.description: The <source> element specifies multiple media resources for <audio> and <video> elements. Browsers will choose the first source they support.

items.name: <a>
items.description: The <a> element represents a hyperlink, linking to another document or resource. The 'href' attribute specifies the URL of the linked resource.
The element embeds an image in an HTML document. The 'src' attribute specifies the URL of the image, and the 'alt' attribute provides alternative text for accessibility.

items.name: <figure>
items.description: The <figure> element represents self-contained content, such as images, diagrams, illustrations, code listings, etc. The <figcaption> element provides a caption for the content.

items.name: <header>
items.description: The <header> element represents introductory content at the beginning of a section or page. It often contains headings, navigation links, logos, etc.

items.name: <nav>
items.description: The <nav> element represents a section of navigation links. It typically contains lists of links to other pages or sections within the site.

items.name: <section>
items.description: The <section> element represents a thematic grouping of content, typically with a heading. It's used to organize content into meaningful sections.

items.name: <article>
items.description: The <article> element represents self-contained content that could be independently distributed or reused, such as blog posts, news articles, forum posts, etc.

items.name: <aside>
items.description: The <aside> element represents content related to the main content but not essential to its understanding. It often contains tangentially related content, such as sidebars, pull quotes, etc.

items.name: <footer>
items.description: The <footer> element represents a footer for its nearest sectioning content or sectioning root. It typically contains information about the author, copyright, contact information, etc.

items.name: <ul>
items.description: The <ul> element represents an unordered list of items. Each item is typically marked with a bullet point or similar marker.

items.name: <ol>
items.description: The <ol> element represents an ordered list of items. Each item is typically marked with a number or similar marker.

items.name: <li>
items.description: The <li> element represents a list item within an ordered or unordered list.

items.name: <meta>
items.description: The <meta> element represents metadata that cannot be represented by other HTML meta-related elements. In this snippet, the 'charset' attribute specifies the character encoding for the document.

items.name: <link>
items.description: The <link> element defines relationships between the current document and external resources. In this snippet, it's used to link an external stylesheet to the HTML document.

items.name: <script>
items.description: The <script> element is used to embed or reference executable code, typically JavaScript, within an HTML document. In this snippet, it's used to link an external JavaScript file.

items.name: <style>
items.codeSnippet:
<style>
	/* CSS styles */
	body { font-family: Arial, sans-serif; }
</style>
items.description: The <style> element contains CSS rules for styling the HTML document. It can be placed in the <head> section or directly within the HTML document.
